reviews.sentence: free bubbles. Stayed for 5 nights. Well located hotel with friendly staff It was my girlfriends birthday and they surprised us by leaving a free bottle of bubbly in our room. A lovely touch Be sure to check out the beach club as it is a nice facility Only downside is they charge for the loungers at the beach club pool.

My stay at the Tivoli. I really enjoyed my stay at the Tivoli the dining room staff and room staff were excellent so too were some of the reception staff. I would say that I found some not all of the reception a bit off putting. Luckily most of the reception staff were welcoming and informative so it was only spoiled by a few members of staff. When you are coming to the hotel as a guest its very important that the reception staff are welcoming as it counts towards the overall impression of the hotel. I did notice that there were not any brochures or tourist maps of the area available to pick up perhaps this is something that can done in the future.

Happy at the Tivoli Lagos. WE were there for 2 nights. The room was large and clean with a large balcony and view of the ocean and beach and the hotel location was great for accessing all of the local sights. Great staff added to the experience.

One night in Paradise. The location the staff and the retro rooms. This is our second stay at the Tivoli Lagos. We love the town and the hotel is near the historic center. Everything was excellent. We loved the little balcony.

Decorate. Lovely location good beach transfer service and loved the bottle of champagne and cake on my birthday. What I think is need is a good lick of paint on the outside and internal decoration. It makes such a difference.

Tivoli. I really love this hotel. It is a place that I do plan to come back. The staff gave excellent service and very friendly. I could have stayed longer at this fine place. Great place to stay in southern Portugal.

Great relaxing holiday. Friendly staff and relaxing hotel. Fortunately we had a superior room which was more than adequate for our needs although slightly tired looking but charming. We found the beds rather hard but overall it was a very clean and comfortable room. The location was great and we enjoyed a couple of days at the beach club. We definitely would consider a return visit as Lagos was the type of vibrant old town that we enjoy. Well done and thank you for an excellent holiday.

pleasantly surprised. The Hotel was excellent. We received a warm welcome from the boys at the front desk. They could not have been more helpful service with a smile. The room had a balcony and was really clean. The breakfast was amazing such choice. The Hotel had such a lovely warm atmosphere. It was so convenient to the town centre. I would highly recommend it and it was such good value.

Hotel is clean and comfortable and staff are friendly and helpful. Although I can not really fault the hotel it is a little tired in places and could do with renovation. We have stayed here 4 times now and will definitely be returning again. It is in an excellent location for local sightseeing and public transport. Drinks are a bit on the expensive side. Only had breakfast but could not fault selection available Public areas are very comfortable.

Great base in the Algarve. This 4star property exceeded our expectations. The staff were fantastic catering to any need. The hotel common areas were very pleasant from the pool to the bar and other areas. Highly recommend eating dinner in their Pateo Velha restaurant. Great ambiance and great food service. Breakfast buffet also has everything you can think of. An added bonus of this hotel is the Duna Beach Club which is a 10 minute shuttle ride away. Th rooms were a bit small and dated however we learned these will be completely renovated later this year. Other thing we are really small pet peeves that do not warrant a complaint.

Nice but some issues. When booking the pool advertised was in fact the beach club pool and not the one on site which was quite misleading however it was not a problem as the hotel provides a free shuttle bus to the beach and back. We had ants in our room and when notifying reception they sent a member of staff to investigate who said there was no ants. We refused to continue to stay in a room with an ants nest behind the bed the lady at reception was then happy enough to switch us. When a member of staff came to help us move rooms we showed him the ants nest and he did not seem shocked at all. Apart from the ants the standard of the premier rooms was good aside from the balcony overlooking a building site. The reception staff were fairly helpful and breakfast was good. Fresh beach towels everyday is a bonus too.

35 dots. The good Great location ideally situated between town centre and marina. Room was one of the ones recently renovated very nicely done. Nice bathroom with walk in power shower. Bed very comfortable. Remote control air conditioning. Breakfast very nice with plenty of choice. Was very busy every morning but understandable in peak season. Pool area nice with adequate sunbeds but only if enough people decide to go to the beach on the free shuttle bus. If every resident decided to stay at the pool I do not know what would hapenThe badNo view from our room and looking at the layout of the complex I doubt there is a view from any room. Lots of areas of the hotel have not been renovated and are quite tired generally not up to standard of Tivoli hotels we have stayed in previously. Public areas scruffy and dirty entrance walkway very dirty and littered. Has nt been swept or power washed for a long time. Pool area was nt cleaned during the day plastic glasses and bottles blew around in the wind and sunbeds always had remnants of someone elses suncream on them. Half a dot deducted for this. Full dot deducted for the staff unfortunately. Any establishment is only as good as the engaged friendly and helpful staff that run it. With the exception of reception staff we felt we were an inconvenience to all the other staff. Pool bar staff in particular seemed stressed and hassled by having to deal with people and long waits and frankly unfriendly service were the result. Staff in other Tivoli hotels always had a friendly hello for us as we walked by even down to bedroom staff. Not in Lagos. Not sure if it is down to lack of numbers lack of training or poor morale. Unfortunately I do not think we would return. It was not cheap even though peak season. I would expect more from Tivoli.

Not worth the. I read the other reviews and still decided to stay here. If you want a hotel vibe instead of an Airbnb then this is one of the few options to avoid driving or walking to far to be in the center of Lagos. But the hotel itself was not luxury. We were promised one double bed and my boyfriend and I ended up having to sleep in seperate single beds. When we asked for another room we were given this disgusting room with a vomit covered towel laying on the floor in the bathroom on the 1st floor which feels like you are in the dungeon or basement of the hotel. There was no internet service down there so we moved back to our other room. Seems suspicious there were no other rooms we could be put in since the hotel looked huge and not at capacity. The customer service described in other reviews was accurate. I ’m not sure if the staff is overworked or just unhappy to be there but they made us feel like an inconvenience over the room situation which seems unfair when we paid for a double bed and are just asking for them to honor that. Even the wait staff seemed to be annoyed by questions. A lot of the guests we ran into were lost trying to navigate the hotel so I ’m sure the staff gets asked a lot of questions but this is a hospitality business and I chose to pay to stay in a hotel vs an airbnb to be able to have someone help me when needed. Our room was cold decor wise AC barely worked and our sink clogged and plain white. Overall really disappointed in our stay here.

Poor Customer Service. Service from reception staff was poor at best. Hotel had been refurbished to a decent Standard but much work required to improve staff. The staff in the Breakfast room were exceptions to this comment as all were pleasant as were the cleaning staff.
VERY ENJOYABLE AND WOULD STAY AGAIN. STAFF BREAKFAST THE ROOMS LOCATIONNOTHING.
Fantastic hotel and staff unfortunately had some Dutch male golfers staying who were noisy 3 am most mornings who were rude to staff and had a complete disregard for other guests.

Top class hotel. great base for golf. Stayed here for a week in February. This hotel as 29 rooms spread over a huge area in such a way that it seems to be a single story hotel. which it is not. It was quiet in February. The breakfast buffet was excellent not necessarily if you wanted a full English though. The room was smallish but clean and ample. It had all the necessary facilities. Apart from breakfast we did not eat here although the Italian menu looked inviting. The staff and services were very good pleasant greetings. Our room was close to the restaurant and reception area. I think that some rooms might be some considerable distance from the amenities. Good hotel though recommended.

Thanks to everyone in Tivoli Lagos. We were very happy with our choiceReception team is very friendly and super helpful. I requested a toddler cot and it was in a room upon arrival along with a lovely set of kids toiletries soap shampoo and lotion. We were offered a free gated parking outside underground parking facilities €2. We had a quick check in. Initially I booked the standard room but after reading some reviews below I decided to upgrade my room to premier as these were just recently renovated € 15 extra per day. The room was well cleaned every day. Some people complained about the difficulties in getting around in the hotel. Well this unfortunately ca n’t be changed because of the way this place was built. We actually enjoyed exploring their premises when we went in a wrong direction. Every evening we spent a few minutes near a cozy fireplace. Breakfast restaurant is beautiful and clean with good variety of food for both healthy and not so eaters. The hotel chef prepared a lovely cake with a candle for my husband ’s birthday breakfast. The receptionist recommended us a few places where to eat in the city. O Camilo restaurant was the best place we tried in Lagos. Thank you for recommending. The only downside was that sometimes the jacuzi was n’t working or the sauna was cold when we came early in the morning. I can understand why there were not many people in the hotel.

A must hotel. We could not be more happy. FYI this hotel has ice rare in the EUThe room was splendive cleanist hotel in the EUExperience team really wants to help so let themBreakfast was more like a 5 star in EU. Champange 5 island of food freshly prep breakfast items. We will return.

Happy Holiday in Tivoli Lagos. We had a super two weeks in this hotel. From the time you enter the foyer till you leave the staff could not do enough for you the atmosphere is so professional but relaxed. The Beach Club is a great facility to have. The entertainment is very good especially the Elvis Night. We just love staying at this hotel.
TIVOLI. The room was lovely but there is a lot around the hotel that needs done up. It is really quite dated in parts. Although in saying that it is clean and service and food is of a high standard.

can not wait to go back. We stayed here for a week at the beginning of June. The Hotel is in a great location a quick walk away from the town centre and the marina where you would find a great choice of restaurants and shops. Staff were great very helpful and friendly. The hotel rooms are bit complicated to get to at first but after a day no problem. They are clean and spacious with air con and amazing showers. Checking in and out was quick and simple with the receptionists providing maps for walks restaurants and sights. The hotel has a number of restaurants the Portuguese style restaurant was lovely and stylish the buffet style restaurant did have a good amount however a bit pricey. The pool bar was great and served lots of good food and drink. Breakfast had lots of good choice too. The free bus to the beach and beach club was quick and easy. The beach club is calm and classy and served lots of nice food the lounge chairs at the beach are also free for hotel guests which is a plus. The hotel also has an indoor pool and a basic gym its gardens are also nice to see with a pond with turtles. We both work in hospitality and were extremely impressed with the whole hotel. Thank you to all of the staff at the Tivoli Lagos we can not wait to come back.

Would definitely recommend overall a good hotel. Hotel was spotless rooms cleaned daily. Very good breakfast with lots of choice. Staff I spoke to were very pleasant and helpful. Beach at the Dunas club was amazing with free sunbeds for hotel guests. The free shuttle bus runs regularly so definitely worth going. Preferred the beach to the hotel pool which was also fine. Seemed small compared to the size of the hotel but always got a sunbed. Location was good 5 to 10 minute stroll along the waterfront to the old town where most of the bars and restaurants were and 2 minutes to the marina. Our balcony was small with no evening sun although did have a distant sea view. Drinks were pricey compared to the town. There was a happy hour but otherwise generally double the price compared to the town.

Exceptional. We have totally enjoyed our stay at this hotel. It provided full amenities 2 outdoor and 1 indoor pools water temperature was 28 ° C bus shuttle to the beach jacuzi water temperature was 33 ° C gym sauna great breakfast and 247 reception services. Staff was very friendly and polite tried to solve all our requests. It was also great to have our own balcony and enjoy complimentary tea in the room. Fully recommend to stay at this hotel. Some parts of the hotel need renovation.

Fantastic stay definitely recommend. Pool area was lovely with plenty of loungers. Bar area of pool was excellent. Hotel had free shuttle service running to their beach club which has free loungers on the beach. Breakfast was top class and staff were wonderful. Room was very basic.
The hotel facilities and the room were excellent. Friendly helpful staff and great location.

One night stay near Marina. Very pleasant one night stay. Hotel located near Marina short walk from the town center. Reception staff very friendly and ready to help. Room specious enough and clean. Tea is complimentary but water is chargeable 3 euros for large bottle. Espresso machine in the room with 2 euros per capsule if you wish to use. Unfortunately the air con unit outside the room on patio was making noise all night even though the unit was off in the room or some other machine was on and off all night making hard to have a good night sleep. Decent breakfast with plenty to choose from. You can easily do a hike to Ponta de Piedade if you do nt mind the 3 km walk. Would stay there again.

large well presented hotel complex efficient staff great breakfast not disability friendly. Excellent staff good breakfast nice large room with balcony great sea views from room. A very large complex nicely presented. Large complex with minimal lifts. many stairs. Not for persons with walking disabilities.
Wonderful. The staff were super friendly and the hotel located in a great area. The room was comfortable. The double beds were single ones. But still comfy x.

Beautiful hotel and surroundings lovely atmosphere great staff. Fabulous breakfasts. Wonderful evening meals Tranquil indoor polLovely staff and atmosphereNothing too much trouble. Everything was great.
